author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Your eyes rely on a complex three-layer tear film that continuously refreshes with every blink to maintain clear vision and protect the cornea. When blinking slows, such as during screen use, this fragile tear film breaks down within seconds, causing dry patches and discomfort.

#eye #explained #science #kindagross #shorts

title: This is How Fast Your Eyes Dry Out Between Blinks
